vision.notes: Possess bipartite eyes located fronto-laterally on either side of the head. Elliptical in shape.

mechanoreception.notes: As centipedes, they likely possess mechanoreceptors for detecting vibrations and touch, crucial for navigating their environment and detecting prey. Inferred from other centipedes.

chemoreception.notes: Centipedes typically rely on chemoreception using antennae and other sensory structures to detect chemical cues in their environment for prey detection and navigation. Inferred from other centipedes.
